文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_046_chunk1
证据片段: cold-worked Zr-2.5Nb is more susceptible to delayed hydrogen cracking than is cold-worked Zircaloy

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_046_chunk1
证据片段: loaded to a constant displacement in a hydrogen atmosphere at 290 to 420 K

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_046_chunk1
证据片段: With cold-worked Zr-2.5Nb at 293 K the Stage II crack velocity, V, was almost independent of stress-intensity factor, K_I, at about 3×10^-6 m/s, between about 70 and 20 MPa√m

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_046_chunk1
证据片段: At 350 K, the Stage II crack velocity was 2×10^-5 m/s

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_046_chunk1
证据片段: In the pressure range 100 to 10 kPa at 293 K, the V versus K_I curves were indistinguishable

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_046_chunk1
证据片段: at 1 kPa cracking was difficult to initiate

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_046_chunk1
证据片段: deliberate small additions of oxygen to a 10-kPa hydrogen atmosphere stopped the cracking

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_046_chunk1
证据片段: Additions of helium up to 10 kPa had no effect on cracking
